quest.name: Outside Help
journal: Lucia is taking stock of the present situation.
objectives: Return to the main hall of the Baldesion Annex.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: That the Final Days should manifest here too, after everything these people have suffered, is a fate cruel beyond words.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Nevertheless, with allies old and new at our side, there is yet reason to be hopeful.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We still need to quiz you about your time on the First, if we ever get more than a moment's respite.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Though there'll be time later to discuss your journey to the First, there is one thing I must ask.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Did you perchance speak with our friends in the Crystarium?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Lyna and Beq Lugg both warn me against overexerting myself?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Strange that they would express such similar sentiments─identical, in fact─but their advice is duly noted.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: We couldn't save them all, but if we'd arrived any later, it would've been a massacre.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Things were looking bleak until you and the Ist turned up.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: This is the contingent's base of operations, I take it?

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: It's been a while since last we spoke. For some time, I was...not myself.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Lucia and the others told me what happened that night...and about the events that took place while I was receiving treatment.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: It was only then that I realized the lengths you and yours go to... I know I might never be able to repay you, but I'll be damned if I don't try.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: And most of all... I want to thank you. All of you. For everything you've done and continue to do for the sake of my people.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I daresay Master Fourchenault was as nonplussed as we to learn the identity of Hydaelyn's lunar custodians. As he will soon discover, they have much and more to offer the Forum.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Might I suggest we return to the annex forthwith?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: We may yet have time to discuss thy recent adventures ere we are summoned to the Rostra.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Not that I'm complaining, Urianger, but I wasn't expecting to see you quite so soon.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Nor I thee. In extolling the virtues of Etheirys, I did inadvertently awaken in the Loporrits a desire to avert our beloved star's demise.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Krile tells us you have obtained new knowledge that may aid us in our ongoing efforts.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I've news to share regarding our study of the aetherial sea, but your findings are certain to be of greater interest, and so I would rather hear them first.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: To what revelations did Hydaelyn's Elpis flower lead?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Then this “dynamis” is what drives the Final Days...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If it and akasa are one and the same, this all but proves Nidhana's theory.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Were an entity, through sheer force of emotion, to channel this vast, dormant reservoir into a raging river...its power might surpass even that of aether.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But if our star is so replete with aether, said entity would need to be outside its influence to effectively manipulate the dynamis of the great expanse.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Meteion...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Or rather, the sorrow and suffering of fallen civilizations that she has been hoarding for millennia...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Untold anguish and fear and hatred, drawn from every corner of the universe... All for a single purpose: the destruction of Etheirys.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Then our foe is no longer some unknowable calamity.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: We have but one aim─to defeat Meteion.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: You make it sound so simple...but you're not wrong.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Vanquish Meteion and we deliver the world from the Final Days. But to even attempt it, there are two conditions.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: First, we must determine her location.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Before Meteion escaped, an enchantment was placed upon her by Venat. The woman who would become Hydaelyn.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The implications of temporal magicks are not entirely understood, and so we cannot assume that our Hydaelyn and the Venat you met in Elpis are one and the same. Nevertheless, due to Her intrinsic qualities as an all-powerful being, I'd wager that Hydaelyn possesses the knowledge we seek.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Whether She would share that knowledge with us, however, remains to be seen.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: After all, She intends for us to flee Etheirys, not to stay.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Do you suppose She has abandoned Her pursuit of Meteion?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: The Venat I know would never give up.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No, but Meteion is still out there.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: That's my impression, too. Otherwise, She wouldn't have used me as a conduit for Her will, or provided clues such as the Elpis flower.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Aye, though not for lack of trying on Hydaelyn's part. Surely, that's why She used me as a conduit for Her will, and provided clues such as the Elpis flower.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I believe She has been waiting...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: ...For mankind's answer to Hermes's question.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: So, what's the second condition?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We must find a means to reach Meteion.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Naturally, our chosen method will depend entirely upon wheresoever she has made her nest.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Then communing with Hydaelyn must by necessity come first.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Did you and Master Matoya have any luck with your investigation into the aetherial sea?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Sadly not. Though we enlisted the help of Arenvald and other Echo-blessed allies, we couldn't detect so much as a whisper from Hydaelyn, even from within the Antitower.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Master Matoya is of the opinion that in the years since abandoning it, the Forum has found some other method of receiving instructions from Hydaelyn.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If so, it would most likely be some form of apparatus for observing the aetherial sea, built closer to home.

dialogue.name: OJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: (-Ojika Tsunjika-)Sorry to interrupt, we've just received word from the Forum.

dialogue.name: OJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: (-Ojika Tsunjika-)Your presence is required in the Rostra, where they intend to discuss the great exodus.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Then Father was able to persuade them!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: They're finally taking us seriously. Let's hear what they have to say.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Father has granted us the opportunity we've been waiting for.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Though we know not what information─if any─they intend to reveal, there's only one way to find out. To the Rostra!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Well, that was a much quicker response than I was expecting. Nice to know our efforts on the Magna Glacies didn't go unnoticed.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: After sending G'raha and Estinien back to Garlemald, I stayed in Locus Amoenus for a time. Being an imperial province, it was already in turmoil before the onset of the Final Days.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: You wouldn't believe the difficulties we had overseeing the evacuation of the villages we visited. I have faith the detachment we left behind will continue our work and shepherd the people to safety. To what safety can be found in a world coming to an end.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Twas Hydaelyn's commandment that in the event Zodiark should perish, the Loporrits were to deliver the people of Etheirys from harm.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Though that be the limit of their duties, they possess knowledge unparalleled of the great expanse and the means of its traversal.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Should they be persuaded to assist in our efforts to reach Meteion, we would do well to heed their counsel.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Master Matoya has suspected for some time that the Forum has been constructing a new facility for the purpose of surveying the aetherial sea.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Of course, as the custodian of the Antitower, which would presumably be rendered obsolete as a result, she has a few things to say about that. Nothing that should be repeated in polite company, you understand.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: To think the Crystal Tower of the First is capable of such feats as sending one's soul into the distant past...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: The events you witnessed─and helped shape─may yet hold the key to forestalling the Final Days.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I'm reminded of dear friends in a future I unmade. Whose selfless efforts saw the Eighth Umbral Calamity averted...in this timeline, at least. Too much has been sacrificed for us to abandon Etheirys now.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: At first, I wasn't sure what to make of Hermes and his motives.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: But it's like we discussed at the Great Work. When faced with the harsh realities of life, some seek the release of death. Others grow defiant. They fight.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Either way, it is our right to choose.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: After you left for Garlemald, I went to Labyrinthos and tried to reach Hydaelyn using the Elpis flowers.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Alas, my attempts were in vain. I can only assume that She spent a vast amount of Her power in the confrontation with Fandaniel and is presently unable to communicate.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Indeed, as Her presence left my body, I could feel how faint it had grown...

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: I hope you don't mind me staying behind while you attend your big meeting.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: The Rostra reminds me a bit too much of the Supremely Scary Tribunal in Ishgard. You'll forgive me if I keep my distance...

dialogue.name: THEROSTRAGUIDE04440
dialogue.text: The Forum is in session, and as such, the Rostra is closed to visitors.

dialogue.name: THEROSTRAGUIDE04440
dialogue.text: A Scion of the Seventh Dawn? Very well, you may wait in the corridor.

dialogue.name: THEROSTRAGUIDE04440
dialogue.text: Of course, entry will only be permitted on the condition you leave your armaments at the door. Lest you forget, this sacred institution holds rational discourse in the highest; the implements of war are expressly forbidden.

dialogue.name: THEROSTRAGUIDE04440
dialogue.text: I suggest you make your way inside. The Forum takes a rather dim view of lateness.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: While I very much take issue with the Forum's approach to selecting whom to save and when, they're not wrong for wanting to minimize potential conflicts.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Fortunately, if this plan of ours actually works, the great exodus itself will become entirely unnecessary...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: My affinity for espionage may have earned me the title of Archon, but I was completely unaware of the Forum's plans. There may have been clues here and there, had I been of a mind to look for them...but contemplating that possibility only serves to further wound my pride.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Not that anyone could have realistically surmised that their brilliant stratagem was to build a giant ship, fly to the moon─a still-larger vessel in truth─and use that to travel to another star. Even now, the whole idea seems positively absurd when spoken aloud.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Of late, I have seen no sign of the Loporrits...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: This being their first opportunity to experience the wonders of Sharlayan, the potential for misadventure is nigh infinite...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I'm a little vexed that we've yet to learn of the Forum's replacement for the Antitower, though I expect that in time, they'll share that too with us─and with Master Matoya, if they've any sense.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: The further we pursue the mysteries of the universe, the more I struggle to comprehend the fortuitous nature of time itself.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: We measure and quantify it based on observations of celestial bodies, such as the sun and moon, but from your account it is unclear whether the ancients viewed time in a similar manner...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I mention this because while Venat knew the Final Days would reoccur at a defined point in the future, she presumably had no way of knowing exactly when.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Even so, the completion of the Forum's preparations to escape to the moon aligning so closely with the advent of the Final Days is surely no coincidence...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Perhaps if Midgardsormr were still alive─in the traditional sense, that is─he could have offered to help the vessel attain the necessary speeds.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Then again, there's no guarantee his contribution would make enough of a difference to matter.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Phew... I'll admit, bringing up the issue of the Forum's incomplete ark was more than a little daunting.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: They were, to their credit, quite open about the current state of affairs. What was even more surprising, though, was when they took Alphinaud up on his offer!

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Rest assured, I have every intention of honoring the Forum's decision.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Sorry about not letting the rest of you in on my plan. I was, admittedly, thinking on my feet for the most part.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But since we require both a means of communing with Hydaelyn and reaching Meteion...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...In the spur of the moment, I saw involving ourselves with the completion of the ark as a way to work towards both objectives simultaneously.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: However, we must first keep our end of the bargain by solving the problem of the aetherburner.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I'd like to think it is not a challenge beyond our combined expertise. Or at least the expertise of our extended circle of associates.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It might behoove us to learn how an aetherburner actually works before we attempt to improve it, though!
